business.headline: Former RBI governor Urjit Patel appointed IMF executive directorUrjit Patel, who succeeds K. Subramanian in the role, will represent India along with neighbouring countries at the Washington-based global lender.

Sensex, Nifty open higher after two-day sell-off amid US tariff jittersAt 9:22 am, the S&P BSE Sensex rose 112 points to 80,193.25, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 45 points to 24,545.90. Broader markets also edged higher as volatility eased slightly.

IndiGo gets another six-month extension to lease Turkish Airlines planesThe extension will help IndiGo cut losses caused by geopolitical restrictions, the airline said, referring to an airspace ban imposed by Pakistan on Indian airlines earlier this year that has led to longer routes and higher costs.

India to boost Russian oil imports in September despite US pressure: ReportIndia has become Russia's biggest oil customer since Western sanctions forced Moscow to redirect supplies in 2022. Cheaper Russian crude has helped Indian refiners keep costs down, but the trade has also attracted criticism.

India extends duty-free cotton imports to shield textile sector from US tariffsFor mills, the duty-free extension offers much-needed relief. The earlier exemption, ending in September, was too short to allow large imports, as shipments from exporting nations often take more than a month.

CIBIL Decoded: How delayed credit score updates can hit your loans and ratesA delay of even a few weeks in updating information with the credit bureau can decide whether a person gets a loan, how much interest they pay, or if they are denied altogether.

Sensex drops 1,500 points in two sessions: Will US tariffs keep hitting D-Street?Dalal Street remains volatile as global trade tensions collide with domestic pressures. Investors face uncertainty, with heavyweights under pressure, mid- and small-caps slipping, while cautious buying emerges at key support levels.

More taxes coming from people than companies, finds reportFor the first time, personal income tax collections in India have overtaken corporate tax, signalling a major shift in the country's tax landscape.

GST 2.0: Which states will take the biggest hit if taxes drop?GST 2.0 promises lower taxes and cheaper goods, but the real challenge looms for revenue-dependent states. The question is, who absorbs the shortfall when the proposals come into effect?
Sensex closes 706 points lower; Nifty below 24,600; HCLTech down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 706 points to close at 80,080.57, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 211.15 points to end at 24,500.90.

India on track to become 2nd largest economy by 2038: ReportWith a combination of a young population, rising domestic consumption, fiscal discipline, and structural reforms, India appears well-positioned to climb the global economic ladder in the coming decades.

Don't miss this step after filing ITR: Here's what to doSimply filing your ITR is not enough. You must verify it within 30 days, else, missing this important step could mean delays, penalties, and even your return being declared invalid.

entertainment.headline: Farah Khan unveils Aunty Kisko Bola teaser, Sajid-Ssunita join as judgesFarah Khan has launched a quirky YouTube talent show titled 'Aunty Kisko Bola', dedicated to showcasing women's talents regardless of age. The show will feature rotating guest judges, starting with Sajid Khan and Ssunita Ahuja.

Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce enjoy college football in 1st outing after engagementTaylor Swift and Travis Kelce made their first public appearance after announcing their engagement. Several viral pictures and videos showed the singer flaunting her sparkling diamond ring.

Govinda, Ssunita dance together at Ganesh Visarjan amid divorce rumours. VideosActor Govinda and his wife Ssunita Ahuja ended divorce rumours by celebrating Ganesh Chaturthi with their family, performing the visarjan rituals with son Yashvardhan. Ssunita also addressed the media, firmly dismissing the speculation and reaffirming their bond.

Salman Khan dances to dhol at Ganpati visarjan, Sonakshi-Zaheer join. WatchSalman Khan participated in Ganpati visarjan by shaking a leg at the grand festivities, which were held by his sister, Arpita Khan Sharma. A video of the superstar dancing to dhol has emerged online.

The Thursday Murder Club review: Immersive whodunnit defying ageing stereotypesRelease Date:Thu Aug 28, 2025The Thursday Murder Club review: 'The Thursday Murder Club', a classic whodunnit blended with humour, is about veteran sleuths investigating unsolved mysteries. The film is an homage to Agatha Christie and Alfred Hitchcock. Is the mystery-comedy worth your time? Here is our review.

Ranveer Singh lights up Ganpati bash as he dances to Deva Shree Ganesha songRanveer Singh danced to 'Deva Shree Ganesha' song at the Ganpati festivities at Ambani residence, Antilia. Deepika Padukone accompanied him to the event.

Ariana Grande announces 2026 Eternal Sunshine tour after seven yearsAriana Grande returns with The Eternal Sunshine Tour in 2026, her first in seven years, featuring US and London shows, blending her music career with Hollywood success after Wicked.

Radio legend Gary Burbank, longtime WLW host, dies at 84 after illnessRadio legend Gary Burbank, famed WLW host and creator of colorful comedy characters, died at 84 after a long illness. He left a legacy in broadcasting, music, and philanthropy.

Nila Madhab Panda's Spying Stars to compete at Busan International Film Festival'Spying Stars' is the only Indian co-production competing in the Busan International Film Festival's new competitive section. The film's themes of AI and humanity highlight a timely cinematic exploration amid changing festival formats.

Pati Patni Aur Woh Do shoot disrupted by clash between crew and locals in PrayagrajFilming of Pati Patni Aur Woh 2 has started in Prayagraj amid tensions between locals and the film crew. Viral videos reveal physical fights and heated exchanges, raising concerns over shoot disruptions.

Lokah Chapter 1 Chandra review: Promising world-building hampered by clichesRelease Date:Thu Aug 28, 2025Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra movie review:  Director Dominic Arun's 'Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra' is a superhero film starring Kalyani Priyadarshan, Naslen and Sandy in lead roles. Despite predictable and familiar screenplay, the film is technically strong.

Anusha Dandekar on going public with relationships, dealing with break-ups and trollsActor Anusha Dandekar opens up about her very public relationships and past break-ups. She discussed the balance between privacy and publicity and the mixed reactions she received online.

Nandamuri Balakrishna's Akhanda 2 release postponed, new date to be announced soonThe release of 'Akhanda 2', starring Balakrishna and directed by Boyapati Srinu, has been postponed. The makers promise a grand cinematic experience with a new date to be announced soon.

Honey Singh backs out of award show over security concerns: SourcesHoney Singh backed out of a Mohali award show due to denial of personal bodyguards. The cancellation has sparked a financial dispute between the artist and organisers.

Shilpa Shirodkar is driven by greed in first look from JatadharaShilpa Shirodkar stars as Shobha in the upcoming supernatural drama 'Jatadhara'. The film promises a mysterious storyline with a powerful female lead.

The Summer I Turned Pretty S3 episode 8: The conversation that never was In 'The Summer I Turned Pretty' Season 3, episode 8, Belly and Jeremiah's pre-wedding talk skipped over the real issues. Here's the messy, honest showdown that should have happened.

Emma Heming on moving Bruce Willis to new home amid dementia: Hardest decisionBruce Willis is living separately under full-time care as he battles frontotemporal dementia. His family has adjusted living arrangements to provide tailored support and maintain close bonds.

Sidharth Malhotra shares fatherhood tales on The Great Indian Kapil ShowSidharth Malhotra appeared on The Great Indian Kapil Show to promote his film Param Sundari. He shared heartfelt stories about his new role as a father, bringing warmth and laughter to the episode.

Taylor Swift's engagement post with Kelce becomes most reposted on InstagramPop star Taylor Swift and athlete Travis Kelce's engagement post amassed over 1 million reposts in just six hours. While in the first hour alone, it received 14 million likes.

general news.headline: Quad, AI, semi-conductors: PM Modi's jam-packed schedule in Japan Live UpdatesThe two sides will go beyond signing MoUs, with Prime Minister Modi and his Japanese counterpart expected to deliberate on the prevailing geopolitical and geo-economic landscape amid US President Donald Trump's ongoing trade war, Indian envoy to Japan Sibi George said.

Cloudbursts in Uttarakhand's Chamoli and Rudraprayag districts, 8 missingA cloudburst in Uttarakhand's Rudraprayag and Chamoli districts triggered flash floods, collapsing houses and bridges, leaving families trapped and livestock buried.

Putin's war chest: Trump aide's fresh 'India-Russia oil mathematics' rantIn a series of posts on X, Peter Navarro argued that Indian refiners, in partnership with "silent Russian partners", were turning the discounted crude oil into profits on the international market while funnelling hard currency back to Moscow.

Why India playing Pakistan in cricket no longer fills me with hopeCricket once united India and Pakistan with shared passion, but terror, hostility, and politics have drained its joy. Today, contests feel driven more by commerce than by hope or healing.

The Thursday Murder Club review: Immersive whodunnit defying ageing stereotypesRelease Date:Thu Aug 28, 2025The Thursday Murder Club review: 'The Thursday Murder Club', a classic whodunnit blended with humour, is about veteran sleuths investigating unsolved mysteries. The film is an homage to Agatha Christie and Alfred Hitchcock. Is the mystery-comedy worth your time? Here is our review.

Former RBI governor Urjit Patel appointed IMF executive directorUrjit Patel succeeds K. Subramanian and will represent India, along with neighbouring countries including Bangladesh, Bhutan, and Sri Lanka, at the Washington-based global financial institution.

Trump in incredible health, but I'm ready to lead if tragedy strikes, says VanceJD Vance praised Trump's "incredible energy" and health in a USA Today interview but acknowledged he is prepared to assume the presidency if tragedy strikes, while also weighing in on global and cultural headlines.

Tamil Nadu BJP functionary beaten to death by gang of men, accused on the runBJP commerce wing member Satheesh Kumar was killed in Tamil Nadu's Sivagangai after a drunken clash. Police said the murder was due to personal reasons, not politics. The accused are still absconding, with arrests expected soon.

Govinda, Ssunita dance together at Ganesh Visarjan amid divorce rumours. VideosActor Govinda and his wife Ssunita Ahuja ended divorce rumours by celebrating Ganesh Chaturthi with their family, performing the visarjan rituals with son Yashvardhan. Ssunita also addressed the media, firmly dismissing the speculation and reaffirming their bond.

Heavy rain lashes Delhi-NCR, red alert issued for Noida, GhaziabadThe weather department's nowcast has placed Gautam Buddha Nagar and Ghaziabad in Uttar Pradesh under red alert, while several parts of the national capital are under yellow alert.

Pregnant Bengaluru techie found hanging at home, family alleges dowry harassmentThe victim, Shilpa, who had previously worked with IT giant Infosys, had been married to Praveen for about two-and-a-half years. The couple has a one-and-a-half-year-old child.

Video: F-16 fighter jet crashes in Poland during airshow rehearsal, pilot killedA Polish F-16 crashed during airshow practice in Radom, killing its pilot. The accident damaged the runway, forcing cancellation of the August 30-31 Radom Airshow.

Diamond League Final: Rare off-day for Neeraj as fans reminded how high the bar isNeeraj Chopra was comfortably outclassed by Julian Weber in the Diamond League Final on Thursday. A rare stumble for a relentless champion, he still reminds fans why they expect nothing less than greatness.

Losses, layoffs looming, how Indian jewellery sector could loosen Trump tariff strangleholdCould India leverage the free trade agreements with countries such as UAE, Australia and Japan to open up fresh opportunities for its gems and jewellery industry?

Vijay may end up helping DMK, hurting NDA in Tamil Nadu, shows MOTN surveyThe DMK-led alliance still calls the shots, despite facing anti-incumbency, with the Mood of the Nation August 2025 survey predicting it to win 36 of the state's 39 seats.

PM Modi's popularity remains, drop for NDA, suggests Mood of the NationPrime Minister Narendra Modi remains the most popular leader, although his government's performance witnessed a 10 per cent drop in the past six months, as per the August 2025 Mood of the Nation (MOTN) survey.

India chase World Cup ticket as Rajgir ready for hockey's grand returnHockey returns to Rajgir once again as India look to use most of their last chance and secure their spot at next year's World Cup by winning the Asia Cup 2025. India, despite their Asian dominance, will be wary of the threat posed by the other sides.

Pahalgam attackers chose Baisaran Valley as it was deserted: NIA sourcesOn April 22, three terrorists of The Resistance Force (TRF) stormed the Baisaran Valley in Pahalgam and gunned down 25 tourists and one local.

Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce enjoy college football in 1st outing after engagementTaylor Swift and Travis Kelce made their first public appearance after announcing their engagement. Several viral pictures and videos showed the singer flaunting her sparkling diamond ring.

Air turbulence to worsen due to climate change, affecting air travel: StudyThe study used 26 global climate models to study how warming temperatures affect jet streams at typical aircraft cruising altitudes, something around 35,000 feet or 10 kilometres.

Big rocks, bigger statements: The rise of supersized engagement ringsJust as everyone was still swooning over Georgina Rodriguez's stunning engagement ring, Taylor Swift treated us to her dreamy proposal photos, giving us yet another supersized ring to admire. Oversized rings have officially become the hottest trend.

Trump not allowing 600,000 Chinese students, White House clarifies after backlashTrump's plan to allow Chinese student visas to be issued drew strong criticism as conservatives interpreted his comments as a signal to increase visa allocations.

Ex-judges call out top court for 'bowing down' to Centre: Allowing to be dominatedJustice Lokur's book reveals the Centre repeatedly pressed to transfer Justice Muralidhar from Delhi High Court after he pulled up Delhi Police over hate speech cases during the 2020 Delhi riots.

Microsoft debuts first in-house AI models for Copilot to take on GPT-5Apart from the OpenAI ChatGPT integration, Microsoft has recently released in-house AI models called MAI-Voice-1 and MAI-1-preview.

sports.headline: Chelsea agrees deal with Manchester United to sign Alejandro Garnacho: ReportManchester United have agreed a £40 million ($54 million) deal to sell Argentine winger Alejandro Garnacho to Chelsea, according to a source close to the club on Thursday.

Naomi Osaka condemns Jelena Ostapenko over heated US Open row with TownsendNaomi Osaka condemned the use of terms like "no education" and "no class" against a Black tennis player, calling them among the worst things to say, as the row between Taylor Townsend and Jelena Ostapenko sparked fierce debate at the US Open on Thursday.

Diamond League Final: Rare off-day for Neeraj as fans reminded how high the bar isNeeraj Chopra was comfortably outclassed by Julian Weber in the Diamond League Final on Thursday. A rare stumble for a relentless champion, he still reminds fans why they expect nothing less than greatness.

US Open 2025: Zverev breezes past Fearnley, Gauff downs Vekic to reach round 3Alexander Zverev made his way into the third round of the US Open 2025 men's singles, while Coco Gauff also progressed ahead, beating Donna Vekic. Zverev beat Jacob Fearnley in straight sets while Gauff had to recover from numerous service errors.

National Sports Day 2025: India honours Major Dhyan Chand as Hockey Asia Cup beginsIndia celebrates National Sports Day on August 29, in honour of hockey legend Major Dhyan Chand. This year, the day coincides with the start of the Men's Hockey Asia Cup 2025 in Rajgir, Bihar.

India chase World Cup ticket as Rajgir ready for hockey's grand returnHockey returns to Rajgir once again as India look to use most of their last chance and secure their spot at next year's World Cup by winning the Asia Cup 2025. India, despite their Asian dominance, will be wary of the threat posed by the other sides.

Lionel Messi hints at emotional home farewell in September World Cup qualifierLionel Messi has hinted that Argentina's World Cup qualifier against Venezuela on September 4 in Buenos Aires could be his final home game, signaling the approaching end of a legendary international career fans hoped would never close.

Jannik Sinner breezes past Alex Popyrin, Iga Swiatek takes down LamensDefending champion Jannik Sinner dominates Alex Popyrin in straight sets to reach the US Open third round. Iga Swiatek and Naomi Osaka also advance, setting up high-stakes clashes as the tournament heads into its second week.

PSG handed toughest Champions League draw, Real Madrid and Liverpool face tough testThe 2025/26 UEFA Champions League draw pits PSG against Bayern, Chelsea, Arsenal, and more in a tough group, while Bayern face Chelsea and PSG. Real Madrid take on Manchester City, Liverpool, Juventus, and other heavyweights, promising a thrilling season opener.

Satwik and Chirag storm into quarters on dream day for Indian shuttlersBWF World Championships: Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty outclassed higher-ranked Liang Wei Keng and Wang Chang of China 19-21, 21-15, 21-17 to book a place in the quarterfinals. Earlier in the day, PV Sindhu and the mixed doubles duo of Dhruv Kapila and Tanisha Crasto also made it to the last-eight in Paris.

Diamond League Final: Neeraj extends 4-year streak, but red-hot Weber wins crownNeeraj Chopra salvaged second place in Zurich with a last-throw effort, but Julian Weber's dominance left the Indian ace chasing shadows. With the World Championships looming, the stage is set for a high-voltage showdown next month.

Lionel Messi hints at emotional home farewell in September World Cup qualifierLionel Messi has hinted that Argentina's World Cup qualifier against Venezuela on September 4 in Buenos Aires could be his final home game, signaling the approaching end of a legendary international career fans hoped would never close.

Jannik Sinner breezes past Alex Popyrin, Iga Swiatek takes down LamensDefending champion Jannik Sinner dominates Alex Popyrin in straight sets to reach the US Open third round. Iga Swiatek and Naomi Osaka also advance, setting up high-stakes clashes as the tournament heads into its second week.

Real Madrid take on Manchester City, Liverpool, Juventus, and other heavyweights, promising a thrilling season opener.

Earlier in the day, PV Sindhu and the mixed doubles duo of Dhruv Kapila and Tanisha Crasto also made it to the last-eight in Paris.

With the World Championships looming, the stage is set for a high-voltage showdown next month.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
